results.name: Hafnian of a +/-1 array.
comment: a(n) is the Hafnian of the triangular array (a(i,j))_{1<=i<j<=2n} defined by a(i,j) = (-1)^i. The Hafnian is the same as the Pfaffian except without the alternating signs, that is, the Hafnian of the upper triangular array (a(i,j))_{1<=i<j<=2n} is the sum of the products a(i1,j1)*a(i2,j2)*...*a(in,jn) taken over all perfect matchings of [2n] written so that i1<j1, i2<j2, ..., in<jn and i1<i2<...<in.

a(n) is also the total weight of Dyck n-paths with the weight of a Dyck path defined as (-1)^(sum of the upstep heights) times the product of the upstep heights. For example, the Dyck 4-path P = UUDUUDDD has upsteps ending at heights 1,2,2,3 respectively and so weight(P) = (-1)^8 times (1*2*2*3) = +12.
